intro: Hieracium erythrodes, commonly known as the red-centred hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring basal rosettes of leaves and bright yellow flowers with a distinctive red central disc. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium erythrodes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
